headline: Tutor Perini Announces Conference Call to Discuss Second Quarter 2025 Results
summary: LOS ANGELES, July 29, 2025--Tutor Perini Corporation (NYSE: TPC) (the "Company"), a leading civil, building and specialty construction company, announced today that it will host a conference call at 2:00 PM Pacific Time on Wednesday, August 6, 2025, to discuss the Company's second quarter 2025 results.

headline: TNS Half Year 2025 Robocall Report: Bad Actors Exploiting Non-IP Networks of Smaller Carriers
summary: RESTON, Va., July 29, 2025--New data, released today in the Transaction Network Services (TNS) 2025 Half Year Robocall Investigation Report, reveals that bad actors are increasingly able to exploit vulnerabilities within smaller carrier networks that have not fully migrated from legacy to all-IP networks.

headline: M2M/IoT Communications Global Market Research Report 2025 | Managed Service Providers Enhance Global IoT Expansion, Focus on Vertical Integration
summary: The global cellular IoT market surged 14% in 2024, reaching 3.8 billion subscriptions, led by China. Forecasts predict 6.4 billion connections by 2029, growing at an 11% CAGR. headline: Parloa Names Chris Silver as Chief Revenue Officer Following $1Bn Valuation
summary: NEW YORK & BERLIN, July 29, 2025--Chris Silver has joined global agentic AI leader Parloa as Chief Revenue Officer. Silver was previously with Five9 and AT&T.

headline: American Tower lifts 2025 property revenue forecast as wireless carriers vie for infrastructure
summary: Competition among wireless service providers has been rising as they rush to enhance capacity for 5G services, benefiting companies like American Tower.  The Boston, Massachusetts-based company leases space at its communication sites to wireless service providers, radio and television broadcasters and other firms that require network infrastructure.  Telecom firms including AT&T, T-Mobile and Verizon  accounted for 86% of revenue for the property segment in the U.S. and Canada last year.

headline: Ericsson announces completion of Aduna transaction
summary: Today, Ericsson (NASDAQ: ERIC) announces the completion of the equity investments by twelve global communication service providers (CSPs) into its subsidiary Aduna, formally establishing Aduna as a 50:50 joint venture. Aduna was created to combine and sell aggregated network Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) globally. It has been operational since the deal signed on 11 September 2024.
